LanguageData.FactionLoadout_NothingHere: Huh, there's nothing here... Why not create a new preset by clicking the button below?
LanguageData.FactionLoadout_GlobalOnly: Can only be edited via the global edit.
LanguageData.FactionLoadout_Desc_RaidPoints:
Commonality this faction will attack by raid points.
Each point is like points on a graph. Consider (300, 0) and (500, 1):
They'll never attack until 300 then gradually become more common between 300 and 500, then remain the same.
If you use the same left number twice, last one wins.
LanguageData.FactionLoadout_Desc_RaidLoot:
Amount of loot this faction will drop by raid points.
Each point is like points on a graph. Consider (300, 0) and (500, 150):
They'll bring nothing until 300 then gradually become more lucrative between 300 and 500, then remain the same.
If you use the same left number twice, last one wins.
LanguageData.FactionLoadout_Settings_VanillaRestricti: If true, some vanilla restrictions are applied, such as only allowing materials that a faction has a high enough tech level for, or not giving forced weapons to non-violent pawns.
LanguageData.FactionLoadout_Settings_VerboseDesc: Adds more logs to track down what's being replaced where.
LanguageData.FactionLoadout_Settings_FactionPresetDes:
Here you can manage faction edit presets.
Each preset contains a collection of faction edits. Only one preset can be active at a time.
Hold the SHIFT key to delete presets.
Remember all changes require a game restart to take effect.
LanguageData.FactionLoadout_Settings_PatchKindInReque: Patch forced pawn kinds in PawnGen (Restart Required):

Patch the pawn kind set in PawnGenerationRequests. Should catch cases where the game generates a pawn without taking the patched version from the faction when generating pawns like for royal permits. Currently experimental.
